title: The_White_Lotus_season_3
summary: The article details the upcoming third season of HBO's "The White Lotus," which premieres on February 16, 2025, and is set in Thailand (Bangkok, Phuket, and Ko Samui). The season features a new ensemble cast including Leslie Bibb, Carrie Coon, and Lisa Manobal, with Natasha Rothwell returning from season one, focusing on various guests and staff at a luxury resort.
extract: The third season of The White Lotus, an American satirical comedy-drama anthology television series created, written, and directed by Mike White, premiered on HBO on February 16, 2025. The season was greenlit on November 18, 2022, and was filmed in Bangkok, Phuket, and Ko Samui from February to August 2024.

The third season of ''[[The White Lotus]]'', an American [[Satire (film and television)|satirical]] [[comedy-drama]] [[anthology television series]] created, written, and directed by [[Mike White (filmmaker)|Mike White]], premiered on [[HBO]] on February 16, 2025. The season was [[greenlit]] on November 18, 2022, and was filmed in [[Bangkok]], [[Phuket]], and [[Ko Samui]] from February to August 2024. 

The season features an [[ensemble cast]] of [[Leslie Bibb]], [[Carrie Coon]], [[Walton Goggins]], [[Sarah Catherine Hook]], [[Jason Isaacs]], [[Lisa (rapper)|Lalisa Manobal]], [[Michelle Monaghan]], [[Sam Nivola]], [[Patravadi Mejudhon|Lek Patravadi]], [[Parker Posey]], [[Natasha Rothwell]], [[Patrick Schwarzenegger]], Tayme Thapthimthong and [[Aimee Lou Wood]]. The season consists of eight episodes.

== Cast and characters ==
=== Main ===
* [[Leslie Bibb]] as Kate, a country club wife from [[Austin, Texas]], one of three longtime friends reuniting on a girls' trip<ref name="S3Characters">{{cite web |date=December 16, 2024 |title=Season three of the Sky Exclusive series The White Lotus, from Mike White debuts 17 February |url=https://www.skygroup.sky/en-gb/article/season-three-of-the-sky-exclusive-series-the-white-lotus-from-mike-white-debuts-17-february |access-date=December 16, 2024 |website=[[Sky Group]]}}</ref><ref name="S3Desc">{{Cite web |title=The White Lotus S3 {{!}} Character Descriptions |url=https://press.wbd.com/us/bio/white-lotus-s3-character-descriptions |access-date=December 19, 2024 |website=Warner Bros. Discovery Pressroom}}</ref>
* [[Carrie Coon]] as Laurie, a corporate lawyer and recent divorcée from New York, one of three longtime friends reuniting on a girls' trip<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Walton Goggins]] as Rick Hatchett, a rugged and mysterious man with a [[Chip on shoulder|chip on his shoulder]], travelling with his young girlfriend Chelsea<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Sarah Catherine Hook]] as Piper Ratliff, a college senior studying religion and middle child of Timothy and Victoria<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Jason Isaacs]] as Timothy Ratliff, a financier in jeopardy from [[Durham, North Carolina]], vacationing with his wife, Victoria, and children Saxon, Piper and Lochlan<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Lisa (rapper)|Lalisa Manobal]] as Thidapon "Mook" Sornsin, a health mentor for guests of the White Lotus<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Michelle Monaghan]] as Jaclyn Lemon, a successful television actress, one of three longtime friends reuniting on a girls' trip<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Sam Nivola]] as Lochlan Ratliff, a shy high school senior and Timothy and Victoria's youngest child<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Patravadi Mejudhon|Lek Patravadi]] as Sritala Hollinger, one of the owners of the White Lotus, who pioneered its health program<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Parker Posey]] as Victoria Ratliff, Timothy's wife and mother to Saxon, Piper and Lochlan<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Natasha Rothwell]] as Belinda Lindsey, a spa manager from the White Lotus resort in [[Hawaii]], attending the work exchange. Rothwell reprises her role from the [[The White Lotus season 1|first season]].
* [[Patrick Schwarzenegger]] as Saxon Ratliff, Timothy and Victoria's oldest child, who works for his father's company<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* Tayme Thapthimthong as Gaitok, a security guard at the White Lotus<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />
* [[Aimee Lou Wood]] as Chelsea, a friendly and talkative free spirit from [[Manchester]] travelling with Rick, her much older boyfriend<ref name="S3Characters" /><ref name="S3Desc" />

===Recurring===
* [[Jon Gries]] as "Gary" / Greg Hunt, a man involved with C
anthropic_trending_reason: The_White_Lotus_season_3 is trending because it just premiered on HBO with a highly-discussed creepy opening episode set in Thailand, featuring a mysterious death that has viewers speculating. The show's move to a new exotic location and addition of notable cast members like Patrick Schwarzenegger and Walton Goggins, combined with the series' reputation for dark satire and shocking twists, has generated significant buzz and media coverage.

The show, known for its unique blend of comedy and drama, has garnered attention due to its successful previous seasons and the creative direction of Mike White.

title: Sabrina_Carpenter
summary: This article describes the career of Sabrina Carpenter, an American singer, songwriter, and actress born in 1999 who gained fame through Disney Channel's "Girl Meets World" and has since achieved significant success in both music and acting. Most notably, she has released six studio albums (with her latest "Short n' Sweet" reaching #1 on the Billboard 200), appeared in numerous films, and has opened for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, marking her evolution from Disney star to mainstream entertainment figure.
extract: Sabrina Annlynn Carpenter is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She gained prominence starring on the Disney Channel series Girl Meets World (2014–2017), and signed with the Disney-owned Hollywood Records. She released her debut single, "Can't Blame a Girl for Trying" in 2014, followed by the studio albums Eyes Wide Open (2015), Evolution (2016), Singular: Act I (2018), and Singular: Act II (2019).
anthropic_trending_reason: Sabrina Carpenter is trending because of several high-profile performances and collaborations, including her emotional duet with Paul Simon at SNL's 50th anniversary special and a new country collaboration with Dolly Parton for her deluxe album. Her growing popularity is further evidenced by the addition of a second show at London's Hyde Park, demonstrating her expanding international reach and success as a performer.
openai_trending_reason: Sabrina Carpenter is trending because she recently won two Grammys and appeared on the cover of Vogue. Additionally, she collaborated with Dolly Parton on a new music video for "Please Please Please," further amplifying her presence in the music industry.
